info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 06 at 6:00PM EDT until May 06 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Tornado Warning for... West central Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... North central York County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 600 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles southwest of Gastonia, or near Clover, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Gastonia around 610 PM EDT. Cramerton, Mcadenville, Lowell, Ranlo and Steele Creek around 630 PM EDT. Lake Wylie, Southwest Charlotte, Charlotte Douglas Airport, Belmont and Paw Creek around 640 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this dangerous thunderstorm include Crowders. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
